definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to lock one's door and refuse to see sb

sentences.english: Sense only the "maleficent contacts" and shut them out.
sentences.chinese: 只感知“有害接觸”並拒之門外。

sentences.english: The lifts are in the lobby near the main entrance.
sentences.chinese: 電梯間在大廳靠大門外。

sentences.english: You are a layman in the field of oceanology.
sentences.chinese: 你在海洋學方面是個門外漢。

sentences.english: Door yellow paper for brand, but the suspect Zhang lingfu Lord afraid.
sentences.chinese: 門外高懸黃紙帖，卻疑賬主怕靈符。

sentences.english: North entrance to the embedded Taming stone, quite detailed records.
sentences.chinese: 門外北向嵌有塔銘刻石，記載頗詳。

sentences.english: When a student recently saw two workmen using a pneumatic drill outside his university.
sentences.chinese: 最近有個學生看見兩個工人在大學校門外用風鑽幹活。

sentences.english: Reporters were barred from the courtroom.
sentences.chinese: 記者們被攔在法庭門外。

sentences.english: God, you know, I just can't see beyond the door.
sentences.chinese: 神，禰知道，門外我就看不透了。

sentences.english: Besides English, we have to learn a second language.
sentences.chinese: 除了英語外，我們還須學習第二門外國語。

sentences.english: If you want to have your those polished, please put them outside the door.
sentences.chinese: 如果您希望我們幫助您擦皮鞋，請將鞋放在門外。

sentences.english: Uncle Wang was waiting for them outside the factory gate.
sentences.chinese: 王大叔在工廠大門外等他們。

sentences.english: Toby slapped his hat on his head and ran out of the house.
sentences.chinese: 託比將帽子往頭上一扣，跑出門外。

sentences.english: To the uninitiated, this approach may sound little better than guesswork.
sentences.chinese: 對於門外漢，這種方法聽起來比猜測好不了多少。

sentences.english: Ah, love, why dost thou let me wait outside at the door all alone?
sentences.chinese: 呵，愛，你爲什麼讓我獨在門外等候？

sentences.english: In liberal education punishment no longer exists. Teachers and students are just like friends.
sentences.chinese: 開明教育也將懲戒體罰拒之門外，倡導師生如友。

definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
